subsection: Transnational associations and networks of public regional or other sub-national authorities
relevant_communication:
Annual ECRN Congresses and other events 
 
Workshop: Launch Phase II of Model Demonstrator Regions Gaseous Industrial Effluents as Non-Fossil Feedstock for Sustainable Chemicals Production, Brussels (in collaboration with DG Grow, 9 November 2016)  
 
Workshop: Experts’ Discussion on „REACH and procedures for SMEs“, Brussels (27 January 2016) 
 
Workshop on  Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the Committee of Regions (Brussels) (24 February 2015) 
 
ECRN Position papers and Congress declarations (Industrial Policy (2013); Sustainability, circular economy and bioeconomy (2015), Competitiveness of the chemicals industry (energy, skills, innovation) (2014); Innovation and triple helix cooperation (2013); competitiveness and future challenges (2012); Structural Funds and Europe 2020 (2011) etc.)
goals__remit: The European Chemical Regions Network is an international non-profit association that promotes the European chemical regions. The association pursues the following aims: (1) Advocating common interests towards the institutions of the European Union, (2) Exchanging and transfer of knowledge, (3) Disseminating information and contacts between the chemical regions in Europe, (4) Initiating of projects for the promotion of the chemical regions, (5) Being open to all chemical regions in Europe, (6)     Developing new relationships with business partners, trade unions and other associations and organisations relevant for the chemical regions in Europe.
